plugins.name: Markdown to Figma Layers
plugins.description:
About

Converts Markdown into layers in Figma. Supports tables. Click "Show example" in plugin UI. If sample markdown is generated, yours should work, too.


What's supported

Tables, links, inline styles (only bold and strikethrough), up to 4 Headings, ordered and unordered lists.


What's ahead

Styles customization, checkboxes, maybe images from url, table heading styles could be fixed, support of row-based tables


How to support

Plugin is only published because I like likes. Give a like, share a comment if you're feeling generous, it will make my day 😌


FAQ


Part of my content is not generated. What happened?

It stops generating exactly where it faces markdown that is not handled. It can be a block of code, checkbox, heading level 5+ or something like that. Post a comment and I'll add support unless it's heading level 10 or nested table or something obscure like that.


Can I customize styles?

Not yet, styles are tailored for my project. If you need customization, pls, leave a comment so I'll know it's needed and will do my best to allocate time.
plugins.tagline: Convert Markdown into Figma layers. Tables supported

plugins.name: GeneXus Prototyper
plugins.description:
The GeneXus Prototyper plugin creates a fully functional application prototype based on your Figma design without relying on programmers to import it. You can experience and test the behavior of your design in a real app before sending it to the development team to continue the implementation of the business logic.


🚀 Effortless Prototyping

Generate a fully functional application prototype leveraging GeneXus technology and the Design Import tool.


✨ Designer Empowerment

Craft your design file without the need for programmers in the initial stages of the development cycle.


🛠️ Streamlined Workflow

Speed up the adjustment phase and prototype creation, making the development process efficient and frictionless.


☁️ Cloud Deployment

Get a sharable link to your prototype, ensuring accessibility from anywhere, anytime.


📱 Real App Evaluation

Test the behavior of your design in a real app using just your browser for Web and Angular generators or download the GeneXus Project Navigator for Android and Apple generators.


USAGE

Please refer to GeneXus Prototyper for Figma.


FAQ


Q: What is GeneXus?

A: GeneXus is a Low-Code Platform that automates the software development process, allowing developers to create applications for multiple platforms with reduced effort and time. Know more about us at GeneXus Website.


Q: Who is this plugin for?

A: For designers who have to adjust a design to be imported into the GeneXus platform.


Q: Is it free to use?

A: Yes. There are no in-app purchases when installing the plugin. You just have to create a GeneXus account to start using this powerful tool.


Q: Is the prototype result pixel-perfect?

A: The precision of the prototype depends on how organized, tidy, and clear your design is and how well you've applied the design guidelines, conventions and best practices we recommend while designing your application. Keep in mind that every design decision will impact the runtime result.


Q: Why I'm getting an error saying "Could not connect to the server at this moment" when trying to get logged in?

A: There might be temporary downtimes in our server for maintenance. Please be patient and retry using this plugin later.


SUPPORT


Your thoughts, ideas, and suggestions for improvement are welcome and highly valued. Connect with us at GeneXus Support.

accepted.name: GeneXus DesignOps Team
accepted.description: GeneXus workspace specialized in integrating design into GeneXus knowledge base.

plugins.tagline: A simple plugin for creating a fully functional app from a design file using GeneXus technology

plugins.name: Suggested Links
plugins.description:
Generate links for your prototype based on your frame contents.


This experimental plugin is the result of an ongoing research project. It uses a predictive model to suggest links for your prototype based on the frames' text content. As a result of its research status, errors can occur and unexpected results are common.


Due to the costs involved in deploying the necessary predictive models, the plugin only functions properly when a custom backend URL pointing to an appropriate backend is provided. A template for such a backend is linked below.


-----


> Note: This Figma plugin is part of a master thesis project titled "Predicting Links for Mobile GUI Prototyping" by Christoph A. Johns at German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI) and Aalto University. The project is supervised by Michael Barz and Prof. Antti Oulasvirta. You can find the source code for all parts of this application on GitHub ([backend](https://github.com/christophajohns/figma-plugin-backend), [plugin](https://github.com/christophajohns/suggested-links)).

accepted.name: Christoph Johns
accepted.description: MSc Human-Computer Interaction and Design @ KTH/Aalto

plugins.name: Wormhole
plugins.description:
Convert Figma icons to Android Studio with one click

Brief description:

This Figma plugin facilitates the process of transferring icons from Figma to Android Studio, allowing developers to quickly incorporate their designs into their Android projects. By reducing potential errors and inconsistencies caused by incompatible file formats, this plugin can significantly improve developers' efficiency and reduce delivery time.

Main features:

  • Convert Figma icons to Android Studio-compatible formats
  • Import icons into Android Studio with one click

Use cases:

  • When UI designs in Android apps need to be updated based on design updates and require frequently syncing icons from Figma to their projects.

Instructions:

  • The plugin accesses a user's Figma and Android Studio project data, therefore the privacy and security of the user's information must be ensured.
  • The plugin must be able to automatically update to support the latest versions of Android Studio and Figma.
  • The plugin should provide clear instructions on how to configure the Android Studio project settings to utilize the converted icons.



demo video : https://youtu.be/N_EkWE9NdT0
plugins.tagline: one key deploy resource to android studio

plugins.name: POD Quick Frame
plugins.description:
Multiple frames can be made in print on demand sizes.

Custom sized frames can also be made.


[One click frame Size]

Five frames are created with one click.

  1. Amazon Merch on Demand 4500x5400
  2. Printify 4200x4800
  3. PRINTFUL 3600x4800
  4. REDBUBBLE 7632x6480
  5. Instagram Reel 1080x1920


[Custom Size Usage]

  1. Enter the number of frames you want to create in Count. The default is 5.
  2. Arbitrary name for Frame Name. If not entered, it will be the name of the pixel size.
  3. Enter the pixel size for width and height. Finally, press the Create button. The default is 4500x5400.
plugins.tagline: Multiple frames can be made in print on demand sizes. Custom sized frames can also be made.

plugins.name: Syntaxer
plugins.description:
Syntaxer is a Figma plugin that allows you to color your text like syntax highlighting in Visual Studio Code. It uses the Shiki library to provide accurate and beautiful syntax highlighting for various programming languages.


Color Themes

Choose from popular VS Code themes, such as:

  1. Light+
  2. Dark+
  3. Dracula
  4. Dracula Soft
  5. GitHub Dark
  6. GitHub Dark Dimmed
  7. GitHub Light
  8. Material Theme
  9. Material Theme Darker
  10. Material Theme Lighter
  11. Material Theme Ocean
  12. Material Theme Palenight
  13. Min Dark
  14. Min Light
  15. Monokai
  16. Nord
  17. One Dark Pro
  18. Poimandres
  19. Rose Pine
  20. Rose Pine Dawn
  21. Rose Pine Moon
  22. Slack Dark
  23. Slack Ochin
  24. Solarized Dark
  25. Solarized Light
  26. Vitesse Black
  27. Vitesse Dark
  28. Vitesse Light


Supported Languages

Syntaxer supports up to 175 programming languages. You can set the default language by renaming the text layer to #lang (i.e. #python, #go, #typescript)
plugins.tagline: Colorize your code using syntax highlighting from VS Code themes!

- Allows multiple text layers to be selected
- Automatic language detection option
- Set language via layer name (i.e. #python, #go, #typescript)
- New command: Auto Apply & Detect Syntax
121651.tagline: Colorize your code using syntax highlighting from VS Code themes!

plugins.name: Sync artboards
plugins.description:
Are you using the same screen at multiple spots in the same Figma file across pages? Use this plugin to sync the latest updates to all other artboards with the same name. Make sure that the artboards are not inside any group or section.


How to use this plugin?

Step 1: Make sure that the artboards/frames you want to be in sync should have the exact same name

Step 2: Select 1 or more art board (frame) that has the latest updates

Step 3: Run the plugin and it will look for all other artboards with same name as the selected ones. Then it will replace them with the selected one


No more outdated artboards anywhere!
plugins.tagline: In single click, sync all other artboards with the same name to the selected art board!

62393.name: Sync artboards
62393.description:
Are you using the same screen at multiple spots in the same Figma file across pages? Use this plugin to sync the latest updates to all other artboards with the same name. Make sure that the artboards are not inside any group or section.


How to use this plugin?

Step 1: Make sure that the artboards/frames you want to be in sync should have the exact same name

Step 2: Select 1 or more art board (frame) that has the latest updates

Step 3: Run the plugin and it will look for all other artboards with same name as the selected ones. Then it will replace them with the selected one


No more outdated artboards anywhere!
62393.tagline: In single click, sync all other artboards with the same name to the selected art board!

plugins.name: Export Svg React Icons
plugins.description:
Export Figma icons to React ready svg code.

Select any vector icon designed in Figma while the plugin is open.

The svg code for the icon will show with a copy button.


The following transformation happend to the svg code initially proposed by Figma:

  • Transform stroke-linecap to strokeLinecap
  • Transform stroke-linejoin to strokeLinejoin
  • Transform stroke-width to strokeWidth
  • Transform fill-rule to fillRule
  • Transform clip-rule to clipRule
  • Remove width, height, stroke and fill attributes
  • Adds class "outlined"
plugins.tagline: Export Figma icons to React ready svg code

93475.name: Export Svg React Icons
93475.description:
Export Figma icons to React ready svg code.

Select any vector icon designed in Figma while the plugin is open.

The svg code for the icon will show with a copy button.


The following transformation happend to the svg code initially proposed by Figma:

  • Transform stroke-linecap to strokeLinecap
  • Transform stroke-linejoin to strokeLinejoin
  • Transform stroke-width to strokeWidth
  • Transform fill-rule to fillRule
  • Transform clip-rule to clipRule
  • Remove width, height, stroke and fill attributes
  • Adds class "outlined"

manifest.name: Figma Export Svg React Icons Plugin

93475.tagline: Export Figma icons to React ready svg code

plugins.name: ClarityUX: Predictive Eye-Tracking, AI Heatmaps & Usability Insights for UX Designers
plugins.description:
ClarityUX: Predictive Eye-Tracking, AI Heatmaps & Usability Insights for UX Designers


Transform your UI designs with comprehensive analysis, accessibility insights, and visual attention mapping to boost conversions


ClarityUX is the ultimate design intelligence companion for Figma users seeking to perfect their interfaces. Our powerful AI analyzes your design files to provide actionable improvements, WCAG compliance checks, attention heat-maps, and detailed UX recommendations—all in one seamless workflow.


🔍 Key Features


Comprehensive Design Analysis using Groq and Gemini AI

- Composition Analysis: Get detailed feedback on visual hierarchy, balance, and layout structure

- Design Improvement Suggestions: Receive actionable recommendations to enhance your designs

- UX Enhancement Insights: Uncover opportunities to improve user experience and flow


Attention Heatmaps

- Visual Attention Mapping: See exactly where users will focus their attention

- Focus Area Analysis: Identify key areas drawing user attention and potential blind spots

- Interactive Heatmaps: Dynamically visualize user attention patterns across your designs



Powerful Insights

- Element-by-Element Review: Get detailed feedback on specific components and sections

- Data-Backed Recommendations: All suggestions supported by UX research and best practices

- Export Capabilities: Share insights with your team for collaborative improvement


💯 Benefits


- Save Time: Automate the design review process and focus on creative work

- Improve Quality: Create more user-friendly and accessible designs

- Data-Driven Decisions: Base design choices on objective predictive analysis rather than guesswork

- Learn & Grow: Develop better design instincts through AI-powered feedback


🚀 Getting Started


1. Select design elements you want to analyze

2. Choose which analysis tools to run (Design Review, Heatmap)

3. Review insights and implement suggested improvements


ClarityUX works with all Figma design elements including frames, artboards, groups, and components.


Perfect for UI/UX designers, product teams, and design agencies looking to create exceptional user experiences backed by data and accessibility best practices.


Upgrade your design workflow with ClarityUX today!

[3 free credits Included for new users]

accepted.name: ClarityUX
accepted.description: ClarityUX is a DesignOps automation platform that streamlines the design review process with predictive analysis, boosting quality and saving designers 15-20hrs

plugins.tagline: Boost conversions with predictive AI eye-tracking — heatmaps and usability insights for designers.

plugins.name: Move to Trash
plugins.description:
Tired of manually dragging unwanted elements to the trash page? With Move to Trash, you can quickly move selected nodes to the trash page with just one click. Great news is that, your designs are never lost.


Life is too small to think on to keep an object or to delete it.

Just move to trash & get back later!

No regrets, No loss!

plugins.name: FigmaMate
plugins.description:
1. Fill content with ease: Our content filling tool can automatically fill your designs with text, images, and more.
  2. Access Unsplash images: Gain access to millions of high-quality images from Unsplash, right within your Figma workspace. Breathe life into your designs with stunning visuals.
  3. Meet your new time-saver: our Lorem Ipsum Generator. Generate placeholder text effortlessly, allowing you to focus more on your design's visual elements.
  4. Get inspired with our Color Palette Generator. Create stunning color schemes for your designs instantly, and bring your creative vision to life.
plugins.tagline: All in one Plugin

97595.name: FigmaMate
97595.description:

plugins.name: Pixel Art Studio
plugins.description:
Simple pixel canvas with export in Figma.

Plugin is in early stage of development, any feedback is appreciated.


Features:


Drawing canvas

  1. Left click to draw, right click to erase
  2. Resizing canvas will auto change proportions of pixels inside
  3. Plugin remembers up to 8 last colors
  4. Clear canvas to remove start from scratch


Export

  1. Export drawing from canvas, convert it to 1x1 px squares and group them
  2. Works best when Figma frame is selected


Import

  1. Import every 1x1 px square from selection to canvas
  2. Auto resizes canvas to selected frame size
  3. If Squares is checked will also convert every rectangle to the set of 1x1 px squares
  4. Import will ignore any component or component instance


Convert to squares

  1. Convert every rectangle to the set of 1x1 px squares and group them
  2. Working both with selection and frames
  3. Convert to squares will ignore any component or component instance


Remove overlap

  1. Take every 1x1 px squares with the same coordinates and only keep one that is above in layer list
  2. Works different with selections and frames


Ungroup

  1. Ungroup every group inside selection or frame
plugins.tagline: Pixel art drawing tool with Figma import/export functionality

plugins.name: Multi-Page Background Color
plugins.description:
Multi-Page Background Color 🎨

Tired of changing background colors one page at a time?


With this plugin apply page background to every page with ease.

Save time ⏳ and focus on what matters—designing! Perfect for a smoother, faster workflow.


How to Use:

  1. Open the Plugin: Run the Page Background Manager from the plugins menu.
  2. Set as Current Page Background: Instantly apply the current page's background color to all other pages.
  3. Set Custom Color: Select a new color using the color picker and apply it across all pages.


Done: Your background colors are updated in just a few clicks! 🌟
plugins.tagline: Set consistent backgrounds color for ALL your Figma pages. No need to change color for each page.

plugins.name: Figma to JSON Exporter
plugins.description:
Figma to JSON Exporter is a powerful plugin that converts your Figma designs into comprehensive, structured JSON data. Perfect for designers and developers who need to extract detailed design information for documentation, analysis, or development workflows.


✨ Key Features:

Complete Design Extraction - Captures all visual properties, layout data, typography, and component information

Dual Mode Support - Works seamlessly in both Design and Dev modes within Figma

Structured Output - Generates clean, organized JSON with design tokens and component hierarchy

Developer-Friendly - Perfect for integration with Visual Studio Code and other development tools

Comprehensive Data - Includes colors, fonts, spacing, effects, Auto Layout properties, and component relationships


🔧 Use Cases:

Design Documentation - Create detailed design system documentation

Development Handoff - Bridge design-to-code workflows

Design Analysis - Analyze and audit existing designs

Tool Integration - Import design data into custom development tools

Design System Management - Extract and organize design tokens


🎨 How It Works:

Simply select any design element in Figma and export its complete structure as a downloadable JSON file. The plugin extracts every detail from individual components to complex nested layouts, making it easy to understand and recreate designs programmatically.

Compatible with Figma Design Mode, Dev Mode, and perfect for Visual Studio Code integration.
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma designs into structured JSON data

135563.name: Figma to JSON Exporter
135563.description:

135563.tagline: Transform Figma designs into structured JSON data

plugins.name: Bulk Desaturate: Black & White Image Fills
plugins.description:
Description

Bulk Desaturate makes it easy to convert image fills to black and white in Figma — instantly and non-destructively. Whether you're testing tone, removing visual noise, or creating grayscale wireframes, this plugin simplifies your workflow.


How to use

  1. Select images or shapes containing image fills
  2. Choose a style
  3. Convert images


Features

  1. Supports multiple selections
  2. One-click “Select All” image fills
  3. Non-destructive fill layering
  4. Optimized grayscale presets
  5. Fast and lightweight — ideal for large files


How it works

Bulk Desaturate adds a black and white version of the original image as a new fill layer inside each selected shape. Your original image stays intact underneath, so changes are non-destructive. You can easily remove the grayscale fill by removing this new layer — or just press Undo (Ctrl+Z / Cmd+Z) to go back instantly.


Each style (Muted, Neutral, Punchy) applies a different contrast and exposure setting, so you can match the grayscale look to your design’s mood or testing needs.


Feature requests and feedback

I have plans to make this better and make bulk image editing much easier. While I am working on that, hit me on X (@itssumeetp), via mail (itssumeetp@gmail.com), or leave a comment here.
plugins.tagline: Instantly select all images and convert to black and white. Apply grayscale styles in bulk.

You can easily remove the grayscale fill by removing this new layer — or just press Undo (Ctrl+Z / Cmd+Z) to go back instantly.


Each style (Muted, Neutral, Punchy) applies a different contrast and exposure setting, so you can match the grayscale look to your design’s mood or testing needs.

plugins.name: Layer Auditor
plugins.description:
Scan and audit layers for missing styles and variables.


Layer Auditor helps you audit your designs to ensure all layer properties are linked to appropriate styles or variables. This streamlines hand-offs by eliminating guesswork about styles and variables in the design library for developers. The plugin updates in real-time as you fix the missing styles or variables. If you add or remove layers, simply re-audit the page for the latest results.


Note: It ignores basic shapes, images, and illustrations, as these elements typically don't use styles or variables. If such elements are flagged, you can hover over them to dimiss them from the list.


I'm actively working on more enhancements and I welcome your suggestions. Please DM me on Twitter for any questions or feedback.
plugins.tagline: Scan and audit layers for missing styles and variables.

plugins.name: Noise Effect Generator
plugins.description:
Noise Effect Generator is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers easily add high-quality noise and texture effects to layers.

Key Features:

• Multiple noise types: Particle Flow, Striped, Radial Waves, Maze, Spots, Fiber, Pixelated, Diffusion, Waveform, and Geometric

• Rich adjustment options: frequency, amplitude, density, rotation, and many other parameters

• Amplitude effect adjustments: Normal, Ridge, Wave, Contrast, and Threshold

• Geometry types: Triangle, Square, Circle, Diamond, Line, and Dot

• Highly customizable color mapping system with gradient support

• 15 beautiful preset templates you can apply with one click

• Real-time preview - what you see is what you get

• Multi-language support (Chinese, English, and Japanese)

Whether you want to add texture to illustrations, add depth to backgrounds, or create unique artistic effects, the Noise Effect Generator plugin makes it easy.
plugins.tagline: Add high-quality noise, textures and artistic effects to your designs

plugins.name: Loom Card
plugins.description:
Enhance your design collaboration with Loom videos! 🚀

This plugin allows you to easily integrate Loom videos directly into your Figma files. Simply paste the Loom video URL into the plugin window, click "Add," and a beautifully designed card with the video's details (title, thumbnail, and link) will be added to your canvas. Perfect for sharing explanations, walkthroughs, or visual feedback!


Features:


📋 Paste a Loom video URL and generate a preview card

🖼️ Automatically fetch video details like title and thumbnail

🤝 Embed video links directly into your Figma projects for better collaboration
plugins.tagline: Add Loom videos to your Figma designs effortlessly! 🎥✨

plugins.name: Export Variables to Power Apps
plugins.description:
Export Variables to Power Apps


"Export Variables to Power Apps" is a plugin designed for Power Apps developers, simplifying the conversion of Figma variables into Power Apps variables.


Features:


Transform your Figma variables into Power Apps collections according to your needs, effectively handling variable modes.


Configuration Options: Customize your export settings to meet project requirements.

  1. Structuring Options: Choose between structuring by Figma collections or by variable type.
  2. Power FX Syntax: Supports both English and French.
  3. Color Conversion: Convert colors into RGBA() or hexadecimal formats.
  4. Variable Flattening: Option to simplify the structure of variables.


How to Use:


  1. Open the "Export Variables to Power Apps" plugin.
  2. Configure your export preferences.
  3. Generate and copy your variables.
  4. Paste them into your Power Apps application.


Optimize your workflow from design to development with "Export Variables to Power Apps"!
plugins.tagline: Convert Figma variables to Power Apps variables.

127171.name: Export Variables to Power Apps
127171.description:

plugins.name: Inspector
plugins.description:
Introducing Inspector - the ultimate Figma plugin for inspecting and improving your developer workflow. With Inspector, you can effortlessly inspect your Figma layers, search Figma by layer name, text layer value, or by Figma node id to streamline your development process. Say goodbye to the hassle of manually searching for your Figma layers and their properties. Inspector does the heavy lifting for you, so you can focus on what really matters - creating amazing plugins.


How to Use?


  • On the 'Select' page, select any Figma layer to get it's details
  • Click on your results, to view their basic info, or click on the 'JSON' tab to inspect the layer details
  • On the 'Search' page, you can search by layer name, or text layer value. Filter by page, and layer type to drill down your query even further

  • Search by Figma node id, by entering 'id=' before the desired id


Contact:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc1r2qBhXE5s3MpBnbUiseAA_QeKDAZoc8ZQct3H9Ca43N1vQ/viewform?usp=sf_link
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly search, select, and filter your Figma layers with ease - streamline your workflow

53017.tagline: Effortlessly search, select, and filter your Figma layers with ease - streamline your workflow

plugins.name: WriteAI
plugins.description:
Introducing WriteAI Plugin for Figma! This powerful plugin allows you to generate tailor-made copy for your designs directly within Figma. Customize your copy based on mood, role, audience, content type, and description to create the perfect text for your projects.


To start using WriteAI Plugin:

  1. Install the plugin and open it within Figma.
  2. Enter your API key in the input field. If you don't have one yet, you can acquire it from the OpenAI platform.
  3. Select a text node in your Figma design or create a new one.
  4. Input your desired criteria, such as mood, role, audience, and content type, as well as a brief description of the copy you want to generate.
  5. Click the "Generate Copy" button and watch the magic happen.


The plugin will call the OpenAI API to generate a fitting copy based on your input. The generated text will replace the selected text node or create a new one if none is selected. Your API key will be securely stored in Figma's client storage for future use. To update or remove the API key, simply input a new one or delete the existing one in the input field.


If you have any suggestions for enhancements, encounter any bugs, or would like to share your thoughts on improving the plugin, please don't hesitate to leave a comment.
plugins.tagline: AI-Powered copy fine-tuning tool

53189.name: WriteAI
53189.description:

To start using WriteAI Plugin:

  1. Install the plugin and open it within Figma.
  2. Enter your API key in the input field. If you don't have one yet, you can acquire it from the OpenAI platform.
  3. Select a text node in your Figma design or create a new one.
  4. Input your desired criteria, such as mood, role, audience, and content type, as well as a brief description of the copy you want to generate.
  5. Click the "Generate Copy" button and watch the magic happen.


The plugin will call the OpenAI API to generate a fitting copy based on your input. The generated text will replace the selected text node or create a new one if none is selected. Your API key will be securely stored in Figma's client storage for future use. To update or remove the API key, simply input a new one or delete the existing one in the input field.


If you have any suggestions for enhancements, encounter any bugs, or would like to share your thoughts on improving the plugin, please don't hesitate to leave a comment.

plugins.name: Psuedo Localizator
plugins.description:
Take your design to the next level!

If you have ever been involved with a software or website translation project, pseudo-localization is a process you will be very familiar with. For those unfamiliar with the term, pseudo-localization is a form of QA testing to determine if your files are ready for translation. Quite simply, it’s a trial run for the actual translation.

plugins.name: Properties Shortcuts
plugins.description:
This plugin has 2 uses:

  1. Increment Property To step through a specific instance’s property, only allowing valid combinations.
  2. Next/Previous Variation Stepping forward and backwards through all possible variant combinations

Combined with shortcut keys these are effective ways to view properties


How to use Increment Property

  1. ⌘ + / to access the quick actions menu
  2. Navigate to Increment Property
  3. Tab → to access to properties list
  4. Select the property you want to iterate and press return ⏎
  5. Use the Run last plugin menu command to step again (this can be accessed quickly through the quick actions panel or by setting up a shortcut key)


How to use Next/Previous Variation

  1. ⌘ + / to access the quick actions menu
  2. Navigate to Next/Prev Variation
  3. Use the Run last plugin menu command to step again (this can be accessed quickly through the quick actions panel or by setting up a shortcut key)


How to use quick actions on Figma

How to set up keyboard shortcuts on macOS



If you find this plugin useful feel free to buy me a slice of pizza
plugins.tagline: Quickly step through instance properties to find the right possible combination

50812.name: Properties Shortcuts
50812.description:

  2. Next/Previous Variation Stepping forward and backwards through all possible variant combinations

How to use Increment Property

  3. Tab → to access to properties list
  4. Select the property you want to iterate and press return ⏎
  5. Use the Run last plugin menu command to step again (this can be accessed quickly through the quick actions panel or by setting up a shortcut key)


How to use Next/Previous Variation

  1. ⌘ + / to access the quick actions menu
  2. Navigate to Next/Prev Variation
  3. Use the Run last plugin menu command to step again (this can be accessed quickly through the quick actions panel or by setting up a shortcut key)


How to use quick actions on Figma

How to set up keyboard shortcuts on macOS



If you find this plugin useful feel free to buy me a slice of pizza

plugins.name: Page Numbers for Slides (Paginate)
plugins.description:
Add beautiful, customizable slide numbers — in seconds.

This plugin automatically adds page numbers to your slides with full control over style and layout.

Save your settings as templates and reuse them later. No more repetitive setup!


✨ Bonus: Magic Mode

Let the plugin detect slide background and adjust text color automatically — for perfect contrast every time.


✨ Exclude specific slides

Skip page numbers on selected slides without breaking the sequence. Edit this setting directly in your templates.


Features:


  1. Auto-pagination for your slide frames
  2. Customize font, color, position, opacity
  3. Skip specific slides from pagination
  4. Save and reuse templates
  5. Magic Mode: auto-adjusts text color based on background
  6. Lightweight, fast, and easy to use


Perfect for pitch decks, reports, and any slide-based designs.
plugins.tagline: pagination  slides  presentation  page numbers  template  auto layout  productivity  deck  tools

129277.name: Page Numbers for Slides (Paginate)
129277.description:
Add beautiful, customizable slide numbers — in seconds.

Save your settings as templates and reuse them later. No more repetitive setup!

✨ Exclude specific slides

Skip page numbers on selected slides without breaking the sequence. Edit this setting directly in your templates.


Features:


  1. Auto-pagination for your slide frames
  2. Customize font, color, position, opacity
  3. Skip specific slides from pagination
  4. Save and reuse templates
  5. Magic Mode: auto-adjusts text color based on background
  6. Lightweight, fast, and easy to use


Perfect for pitch decks, reports, and any slide-based designs.
129277.release_notes:
✨ Update:

— Added the ability to exclude specific slides from pagination display. Just enter their numbers — they’ll still be counted in the sequence, but no page number will appear on them. Add as many as you need.

— This setting is now saved and editable inside templates — making it easy to reuse the same layout and just update which slides to skip.

— Magic Mode has been improved to better adapt to different background types.
129277.tagline: pagination  slides  presentation  page numbers  template  auto layout  productivity  deck  tools

plugins.name: Paginate — Add page numbers in one click
plugins.description:
Helps you add page numbers to YOUR design in one click. Perfect for presentations, PDFs, and multi-page layouts.


How it works


Step 1. Name Your Text Layer

Use a specific layer name for your text, or copy the one the plugin suggests. The plugin will replace it with the page number.


Step 2. Arrange frames in a Z-pattern (left to right, then top to bottom).


Step 3. (Optional) Settings:

  1. Choose ascending or descending order
  2. Set starting number (e.g., 2,3,4 or 43,44,45)
  3. Increment numbers (e.g., 1,3,5 or 1,5,9)
  4. Define digit format (1,2,3 or 01,02,03)
  5. Select number type (Arabic numerals or Roman numerals)


Step 4. Select the frames that need page numbers. Click Paginate and watch your layers update instantly!



Additional Info:

Feedback, suggestions, and feature requests are welcome in comments!

Inspired by "PageNum" by Resul Celik, with added features.

accepted.name: Neha Gupta
accepted.description: An itch to solve problems and make lives better.

plugins.tagline: Smart page numbering for Figma layers in seconds

plugins.name: util+
plugins.description:
The 3th utility of Util+ has been released.


v1.2.0

  • Faker Text: Faker Text can generate fake data for various areas, including address, commerce, company, date, finance, image, random, or name.


v1.1.0

  • Offset Frame: Select one frame and create it below the frame


v1.0.0

You can work with the pixels you want by adjusting the value.


  • Step Size: Basically, you can adjust the width and height of 8 pixels.
  • Step Position: By default, you can move the position by 8 pixels.



Second utility 'faker text' is under development

plugins.name: Ebook Frame Creator
plugins.description:
------------------------

it's really just getting startedᅳthink of it as version 0.1.6, but more like a newborn baby I'm nurturing day by day. there is a story behind it. found myself working alongside a team that had this huge task ahead of themᅳcreating 100 ebooks using ChatGPT, no less i thought to myself, there's got to be a way to make this easier.


lightbulb went off, i started piecing together the EbookFrameCreator plugin. It's designed to snugly fit into Figma because, let's face it, we all love how easy Figma makes design work, right? But this plugin? It's a game-changer. It turns what used to be a daunting task into something you can breeze through, boosting productivity like nobody's business by smoothing out and speeding up the whole ebook creation flow.


i didn't just make it for a single team. i'm seeing how much it helped them, it just felt right to share it with everyone. It's kind of my way of throwing a little bit of help out into the world for anyone who's ever found themselves bogged down with design work. I'm all about sharing the love, making sure that creative folks have what they need to make their projects a little less stressful and a lot more fun. yeah, that's the scoop on my little project. Can't wait to see how it grows and helps even more people down the line!
plugins.tagline: Create Ebooks Faster

lightbulb went off, i started piecing together the EbookFrameCreator plugin. It's designed to snugly fit into Figma because, let's face it, we all love how easy Figma makes design work, right? But this plugin? It's a game-changer. It turns what used to be a daunting task into something you can breeze through, boosting productivity like nobody's business by smoothing out and speeding up the whole ebook creation flow.


i didn't just make it for a single team. i'm seeing how much it helped them, it just felt right to share it with everyone. It's kind of my way of throwing a little bit of help out into the world for anyone who's ever found themselves bogged down with design work. I'm all about sharing the love, making sure that creative folks have what they need to make their projects a little less stressful and a lot more fun. yeah, that's the scoop on my little project. plugins.name: Duplicates Finder
plugins.description:
Find and select duplicates across various sets of duplicate layers within a selection.


Layers with identical names are regarded as duplicates.


Duplicates Finder simplifies identifying duplicate layers within a selection. It also allows to exclude one from each set of duplicates or select one from each set leaving the rest unselected. It is especially useful when concerning layers are large in number and/or are spread across multiple groups.


How to use

  1. Select the layers you wish to identify duplicates within.
  2. Click "Find Duplicates" to highlight all duplicates, automatically deselecting one instance from each set.
  3. Use "Select Singles" to choose only one layer from each group of duplicates, leaving the rest unselected.


Upcoming

This is an early version of the plugin. In next updates, I will add additional ways to exclude or identify the duplicates. For example, you will be able to identify and exclude layers based on their properties.


For questions, feedback or ideas, please comment below or email me at basepurpose.com@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Find and select duplicates across various sets of duplicate layers within a selection.
